Senior Threat Intelligence Researcher

Location: Remote / Asia Pacific
Department: Threat Research & Intelligence

About the Role:
We are seeking an experienced Senior Threat Intelligence Researcher to join our global threat research team. In this role, you will conduct deep-dive analysis of ransomware families, APT campaigns, and emerging cyber threats. You will publish original research, develop detection methodologies, and collaborate with security operations teams worldwide.

Responsibilities:
- Conduct in-depth malware analysis and reverse engineering of ransomware payloads, loaders, and post-exploitation tools
- Track and document advanced persistent threat (APT) campaigns, including TTPs mapped to the MITRE ATT&CK framework
- Perform threat hunting across telemetry data to identify novel attack patterns and indicators of compromise (IOCs)
- Publish technical research articles and threat advisories for internal and external audiences
- Develop YARA rules, Sigma detections, and hunting queries for emerging threats
- Investigate defense evasion techniques including BYOVD (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver), EDR bypass, and process injection
- Collaborate with incident response teams to provide threat intelligence context during active investigations
- Enrich indicators of compromise using platforms such as VirusTotal, OpenCTI, and OSINT sources
- Build and maintain automation tools and scripts (Python) to streamline threat intelligence workflows
- Deliver training and knowledge transfer sessions to SOC analysts, incident responders, and partner organizations
- Monitor threat actor infrastructure and track ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) ecosystems

Requirements:
- 3+ years of experience in threat intelligence, malware analysis, or security research
- Strong understanding of the MITRE ATT&CK framework and cyber kill chain methodology
- Proficiency in Python for scripting, automation, and tool development
- Experience with threat intelligence platforms (OpenCTI, MISP, or similar)
- Hands-on experience with malware analysis tools and sandboxing environments
- Familiarity with EDR solutions and endpoint detection technologies
- Knowledge of ransomware families, their TTPs, and evolution across Windows, Linux, and ESXi platforms
- Experience analyzing cross-platform threats targeting enterprise virtualization infrastructure
- Strong technical writing skills with published research or blog articles
- Experience with OSINT techniques and IOC enrichment workflows

Nice to Have:
- Experience with AI/LLM integration for threat intelligence automation
- Familiarity with Model Context Protocol (MCP) or similar AI tooling frameworks
- Experience building Streamlit or web-based security analysis dashboards
- Node.js or TypeScript development experience
- Background in delivering cybersecurity training to law enforcement or government agencies
- Conference speaking experience
- Confluence and Jira proficiency for documentation and project tracking
- Experience with cloud security platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
- Knowledge of network security and traffic analysis

We offer a collaborative research environment, opportunities to publish original research, and the chance to make a meaningful impact on global cybersecurity defense.
